alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 21 at 2:15PM EST until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... River Raisin At Monroe City affecting Monroe County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...River Raisin At Monroe City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:43 PM EST Monday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river level is expected to fluctuate between 10 and 12 feet due to variable ice cover and ice restricted flow along the river. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Impact...Homes, businesses and roads near the River Raisin will continue to be flooded. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
